page.title: 11Old Treworgey Farm.
page.content: Mr.Crabb and his son farm Old Treworgey which is about 115 years old and they have lived on the farm for 29 years. On the land there are 17 acres of fodder beet, 15 acres of barley and the rest is grass. The barley and beet are grown to feed the stock in winter. When we visited the farm there were 22 ewes and 20 calves. In the autumn Mr. Crabbe buys in 700 store lambs. There are only 2 tractors on the farm and most of the work is contracted out. On a marshy piece of ground three ponds had been dug out. The deepest is 9' and the stream through the farm runs through the ponds and keeps the water very clean. 200 trout had been put in the pond but the herons and cormorants had eaten most of them. Also on the farm there are 2,500 chickens in an intensive unit. The lane by the side of the farm is called Butterfly Lane.
